summary.para: The get_Balance method retrieves the balance for the audio signal.

param.name: plBalance
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the balance.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The filter graph does not contain an audio renderer filter. (Possibly the source does not contain an audio stream.)

remarks.para: The balance ranges from -10,000 to 10,000. The value -10,000 means the right channel is attenuated by 100 dB and is effectively silent. The value 10,000 means the left channel is silent. The neutral value is 0, which means that both channels are at full volume. When one channel is attenuated, the other remains at full volume.

summary.para: The get_Volume method retrieves the volume (amplitude) of the audio signal.

param.name: plVolume
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receive the volume. Divide by 100 to get equivalent decibel value. For example, –10,000 is –100 dB.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The filter graph does not contain an audio renderer filter. (Possibly the source does not contain an audio stream.)

summary.para: The put_Balance method sets the balance of the audio signal.

param.name: lBalance
param.para: Specifies the balance. The value can range from -10,000 to 10,000. The value -10,000 means the right channel is attenuated by 100 dB and is effectively silent. The value 10,000 means the left channel is silent. The neutral value is 0, which means that both channels are at full volume. When one channel is attenuated, the other remains at full volume.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The underlying audio device returned an error.
The value of lBalance is invalid.
The filter graph does not contain an audio renderer filter. (Possibly the source does not contain an audio stream.)

summary.para: The put_Volume method sets the volume (amplitude) of the audio signal.

param.name: lVolume
param.para: Specifies the volume, as a number from –10,000 to 0, inclusive. Full volume is 0, and –10,000 is silence. Multiply the desired decibel level by 100. For example, –10,000 = –100 dB.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The underlying audio device returned an error.
The value of lVolume is invalid.
The filter graph does not contain an audio renderer filter. (Possibly the source does not contain an audio stream.)

summary.para: The IBasicAudio interface controls the volume and balance of the audio stream.

This interface is implemented on the Audio Renderer (WaveOut) filter and the DirectSound Renderer filter, but is exposed to applications through the Filter Graph Manager. Applications should always retrieve this interface from the Filter Graph Manager.
